intro: Psychotria quadrifolia, commonly known as the "Maypop" or "Cup of Joe," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. Its fruit is a yellowish, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Psychotria quadrifolia is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of the alkaloid tetrahydrocannabinol (THC).
